msContents.summary: This Aljamiado manuscript contains a compendium of Islamic law written by Baray de Reminjo with the help of a young scholar known as Mancebo de Arévalo. The treatise was composed in Spain in the third decade of the XVI century. A Latin note at the top of the first page states that the manuscript was given as a gift from Engelbertus van Engelen to Henry Sike in 1703.
